hanzi-su-wiki:
昆

Значения

Потом

Мнемоника

Следование 比 живущих под солнцем 日 поколений — потомство. Старший брат (появляется на свет раньше младшего). Насекомое — оно летит на солнце.
purpleculture_pinyin:
kūn
descendant; elder brother; a style of Chinese poetry; used in place names, notably Kunlun Mountains 昆仑 ; (also used for transliteration)
потомок; старший брат; стиль китайской поэзии; используется в географических названиях, особенно в горах Куньлунь 昆仑; (также используется для транслитерации)
rtega_mnemonic:
昆昆RSelder brother, descendants, multitude, insect
  • RS. two men walking 比 in the sun 日 together: one of them is the elder brother: talk about a multitude of insects
purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 崑, 昆)
Ideographic: Two brothers 比 under the son 日
purpleculture_examples:
昆明 [ kūn míng ]: Kunming prefecture-level city and capital of Yunnan province in southwest China
昆虫 [ kūn chóng ]: insect; Classifiers: 只
昆曲 [ kūn qǔ ]: Kunqu opera, influential musical theater originating in Kunshan, Jiangsu province in Yuan times
昆剧 [ kūn jù ]: see 昆曲
昆腔 [ kūn qiāng ]: see 昆曲
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 日 [ rì ] sun; day; daytime
    • 比 [ bǐ ] to compare, liken; comparison; than
heisig_chinese_memo: Grandparent spends all day comparing photos of their descendants.
heisig_constituent: descendants, sun, day, compare, spoon, sitting on the ground, spoon2, sitting on the ground2
heisig_story: By comparing apes with anthropoids, we not only discover the latter have descended from those progenitors educated in the higher branches, but that the very idea of seeing everything descended from everything else, one way or another, means that there is "nothing new UNDER the sun."
koohiiStory1: Grandparent spends all DAY COMPARING photos of their DESCENDANTS.
koohiiStory2: Japanese people have compared themselves as being descendants of the sun. (Amaterasu, the sun godesss). Sun, comparing = descendants.
jp_example_words: 昆虫(こんちゅう): insect, bug
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you compare the sun to its descendants, you’ll notice that the descendants don’t quite shine as brightly as the sun does. You don’t like to compare them, because each sun is special in its own way, but the descendants just aren’t quite as shiny as the original.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Look at the sun and its many descendant stars. Their light burns your eyes, making them water. Picture yourself squinting while you look at these many suns.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: While you’re looking up at the sun and its descendants, trying to compare them to one another, a flock of condors (こん) flies by, blocking out the sun. There’s a great many condors, and they manage to totally block out the light from the suns.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: While you’re looking up at the condors, one of them poops in your eye. Imagine the shame and frustration you feel with condor poo in your eye as you hear the condors screech and flap their wings as they pass by.

Ru_trainchinese: kūn: (графема) (букв.) старший брат; потомок, потомство
Kanshudo_mnemonic: compare (比) the sun (日) with your descendants
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Grandparent spends all day comparing photos of their descendants.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The structure of the inscriptions is unknown, because it is similar to the Qin and Han characters, or interpreted as " Kun ". Bronze writing is used as the country name. Kun [爿𠨬] Wang Zhong: "Kun [爿𠨬] (疕) Wang Chou (cast) Zha (made) and Zhong, his 10,000-year descendants Yongbao." "Kunyi" is the name of the country.

The characters of the Chu family of the Warring States Period can be found in "Guodianjian. "Six Virtues" should be read as " Kun " according to the context. (Qiu Xigui) Such as "Six Des" Jane 29: "For Kundi [𢆶刀] (extremely) wife, not for wife [𢆶刀] (extremely) Kundi." Li Jiahao according to "Khan Jian" and "Four Tone of Ancient Chinese" It is believed that the character form of Chu Jian is the ancient Chinese " Kun ", but it is suspected to be the " Kun " of insects. Huang Dekuan and Xu Zaiguo think that this word starts with " 𦥑 " and " cloud ".

"Shuowen" believes that the original meaning of " kun " is the same. "Said Wen": "Kun, the same. From the day to the comparison." "Jade chapter. "Japanese Ministry": "Kun, Tong Ye, Bin Ye, Xian Ye." Such as "Tai Xuan. "Tai Xuan Ni": "Li Sheng Kun Qun and love is called benevolence." Fan Wang's note: "Kun, Tong Ye." "Selected Works. Yangtze Cloud "Father Hunting Fu": "Xuanluan, peacock, emerald and rosy. Wangjuguan pass, Hongyanqi. The group entertains them, but the Kunming."

" Kun " also means brother, with " 𥊽 ". "Guang Yun. Soul rhyme: "Kun, brother." Such as "Poetry. Wang Feng. "Ge Ming": "Brothers in the end, we call others Kun." Mao Chuan: "Kun, brother." Another example is "Mo Zi. "Miscellaneous Shou": "Sima and above the city guards, parents, Kundi, and wives have pledges in the Lord's house, but they can stick to it."

" Kun " said after. "Er Ya. "Explanation": "Kun, later also." Such as "Shang Shu. "Dayumo": "Official occupation, but first conceal the aspirations, Kun fate to Yuangui." Kong Chuan: "Kun, later also. The method of official occupation, first determine the will of the people, then order the Yuangui, then express the will Bu." "Mandarin. "Jin Yu": "Heaven brings disaster to the Jin country, and the slander is prosperous, and it extends to the Shaoxu Kunyu who is a widow." Wei Zhao's note: "Kun, later."

" Kun " also refers to offspring and descendants. "Shang Shu. "Zhong Yu Zhi Gu": "Wang Maozhao great virtue, built in the people, ruled by righteousness, ruled by etiquette, and surpassed Kun later." Kong Chuan: "The way of good foot shows future generations." "Selected Works. Zuo Taichong "Wu Du Fu": "Yu Wei Zhi Kun, Gu Lu Zhi Yi." Liu Yuanlin's Note: "Kun and Yi are both descendants."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The structure of the inscriptions is unknown, because it is similar to the Qin and Han characters, or interpreted as " Kun ". "Shuowen" believes that the original meaning of " kun " is the same.
humanum_full_description:
金文構義不明，因與秦漢字形相近，或釋為「昆」。金文用作國名。昆[爿𠨬]王鐘：「昆[爿𠨬]（疕）王貯（鑄）乍（作）龢鐘，其萬年子孫永寶。」「昆疕」是國名。

　　戰國楚系文字見於《郭店簡．六德》，據前後文意應讀為「昆」。（裘錫圭）如〈六德〉簡29：「為昆弟[𢆶刀]（絕）妻，不為妻[𢆶刀]（絕）昆弟。」李家浩據《汗簡》和《古文四聲韻》以為楚簡字形為古文「昆」，疑為昆蟲之「昆」的象形。黃德寬和徐在國則認為此字從「𦥑」，「云」聲。

　　《說文》以為「昆」的本義是同。《說文》：「昆，同也。从日从比。」《玉篇．日部》：「昆，同也，并也，咸也。」如《太玄．太玄攡》：「理生昆群兼愛之謂仁也。」范望注：「昆，同也。」《文選．揚子雲〈羽獵賦〉》：「玄鸞孔雀，翡翠垂榮。王雎關關，鴻鴈嚶嚶。群娛乎其中，噍噍昆鳴。」

　　「昆」也表示兄，通「𥊽」。《廣韻．魂韻》：「昆，兄也。」如《詩．王風．葛藟》：「終遠兄弟，謂他人昆。」毛傳：「昆，兄也。」又如《墨子．雜守》：「城守司馬以上，父母、昆弟、妻子有質在主所，乃可以堅守。」

　　「昆」表示後。《爾雅．釋言》：「昆，後也。」如《尚書．大禹謨》：「官占，惟先蔽志，昆命于元龜。」孔傳：「昆，後也。官占之法，先斷人志，後命於元龜，言志定然後卜。」《國語．晉語》：「天降禍于晉國，讒言繁興，延及寡君之紹續昆裔。」韋昭注：「昆，後也。」

　　「昆」又指後代、後裔。《尚書．仲虺之誥》：「王懋昭大德，建中于民，以義制事，以禮制心，垂裕後昆。」孔傳：「垂優足之道示後世。」《文選．左太沖〈吳都賦〉》：「虞魏之昆，顧陸之裔。」劉淵林注：「昆、裔，皆後世也。」
humanum_short_description: 金文構義不明，因與秦漢字形相近，或釋為「昆」。《說文》以為「昆」的本義是同。

kun1
HSK 5: 昆
昆昆RS elder brother, descendants, multitude, insect
  • RS. two men walking 比 in the sun 日 together: one of them is the elder brother: talk about a multitude of insects
(Trad.: 崑, 昆)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: Two brothers 比 under the son 日
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 日 [ rì ] sun; day; daytime
    • 比 [ bǐ ] to compare, liken; comparison; than
①子孙，后嗣：昆裔(子孙后代)。后昆。
②哥哥：昆弟(ａ．兄弟；b．友好亲爱)。昆仲。昆季。昆玉(称人兄弟的敬辞)。
③众多：昆虫(虫类的统称)。
④山名(ａ．“昆山”，在中国上海市和江苏省；b．“昆仑山”，在中国新疆维吾尔自治区、西藏自治区和青海省交界处，亦作“崑芲山”)。
昆明 [ kūn míng ]: Kunming prefecture-level city and capital of Yunnan province in southwest China
昆虫 [ kūn chóng ]: insect; Classifiers: 只
昆曲 [ kūn qǔ ]: Kunqu opera, influential musical theater originating in Kunshan, Jiangsu province in Yuan times
昆剧 [ kūn jù ]: see 昆曲
昆腔 [ kūn qiāng ]: see 昆曲
(Trad.: 崑, 昆)

金文構義不明，因與秦漢字形相近，或釋為「 昆 」。金文用作國名。昆[爿𠨬]王鐘：「昆[爿𠨬]（疕）王貯（鑄）乍（作）龢鐘，其萬年子孫永寶。」「昆疕」是國名。 戰國楚系文字見於《郭店簡．六德》，據前後文意應讀為「 昆 」。（裘錫圭）如〈六德〉簡29：「為昆弟[𢆶刀]（絕）妻，不為妻[𢆶刀]（絕）昆弟。」李家浩據《汗簡》和《古文四聲韻》以為楚簡字形為古文「 昆 」，疑為昆蟲之「 昆 」的象形。黃德寬和徐在國則認為此字從「 𦥑 」，「 云 」聲。 《說文》以為「 昆 」的本義是同。《說文》：「昆，同也。从日从比。」《玉篇．日部》：「昆，同也，并也，咸也。」如《太玄．太玄攡》：「理生昆群兼愛之謂仁也。」范望注：「昆，同也。」《文選．揚子雲〈羽獵賦〉》：「玄鸞孔雀，翡翠垂榮。王雎關關，鴻鴈嚶嚶。群娛乎其中，噍噍昆鳴。」 「 昆 」也表示兄，通「 𥊽 」。《廣韻．魂韻》：「昆，兄也。」如《詩．王風．葛藟》：「終遠兄弟，謂他人昆。」毛傳：「昆，兄也。」又如《墨子．雜守》：「城守司馬以上，父母、昆弟、妻子有質在主所，乃可以堅守。」 「 昆 」表示後。《爾雅．釋言》：「昆，後也。」如《尚書．大禹謨》：「官占，惟先蔽志，昆命于元龜。」孔傳：「昆，後也。官占之法，先斷人志，後命於元龜，言志定然後卜。」《國語．晉語》：「天降禍于晉國，讒言繁興，延及寡君之紹續昆裔。」韋昭注：「昆，後也。」 「 昆 」又指後代、後裔。《尚書．仲虺之誥》：「王懋昭大德，建中于民，以義制事，以禮制心，垂裕後昆。」孔傳：「垂優足之道示後世。」《文選．左太沖〈吳都賦〉》：「虞魏之昆，顧陸之裔。」劉淵林注：「昆、裔，皆後世也。」

昆字的基本解释

昆
kūn
子孙，后嗣：昆裔（子孙后代）。后昆。
哥哥：昆弟（ａ．兄弟；ｂ．友好亲爱）。昆仲。昆季。昆玉（称人兄弟的敬辞）。
众多：昆虫（虫类的统称）。
山名（ａ．“昆山”，在中国上海市和江苏省；ｂ．“昆仑山”，在中国新疆维吾尔自治区、西藏自治区和青海省交界处，亦作“崑??山”）。

Kun
Basic explanation of words
Kun
kūn
Descendants, descendants: Kun Yi (descendants of descendants). Hou Kun.
Brother: Kundi (a. brother; b. friendly dear). brothers. Kunji. Kunyu (respect of brothers).
Numerous: insects (a collective term for insects).
The name of the mountain (a. "Kunshan", in Shanghai and Jiangsu Province, China; b. "Kunlun Mountain", at the junction of Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, Tibet Autonomous Region and Qinghai Province, also known as "Kun?? Mountain").

Kun
Name meaning
: Refers to descendants, descendants; together, common meaning.
kūn
1) старший брат
谓他人昆 чужого старшим братом я зову
2) потомок, потомство
后昆 последующие поколения, потомки
3) масса, толпа; всей массой, совместно, вместе
噍噍昆鸣 все вместе издавали приветственные крики
昆小虫 масса мелких насекомых
4) вм. 崑 (Куньшань, название горы и уезда в пров. Цзянсу)
5) сокр. г. Куньмин
成昆铁路 Чэнду―Куньминская ж.-д.
-----
1) Кунь (фамилия)
2) * впоследствии, потом
昆命于元龟 потом он стал гадать по панцирю черепахи
3) западные иноплеменники, цюаньжуны (犬戎; с дин. Хань)
4) смешивать; быть смешанным; не различать
昆于黑不知白 смешать белое с чёрным и больше не различать белого в чёрном
Radicals: 日, 比  (sun, compare)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you compare the sun to its descendants, you’ll notice that the descendants don’t quite shine as brightly as the sun does. You don’t like to compare them, because each sun is special in its own way, but the descendants just aren’t quite as shiny as the original.
Look at the sun and its many descendant stars. Their light burns your eyes, making them water. Picture yourself squinting while you look at these many suns.
Reading Mnemonic
While you’re looking up at the sun and its descendants, trying to compare them to one another, a flock of condors (こん) flies by, blocking out the sun. There’s a great many condors, and they manage to totally block out the light from the suns.
While you’re looking up at the condors, one of them poops in your eye. Imagine the shame and frustration you feel with condor poo in your eye as you hear the condors screech and flap their wings as they pass by.
